Pre-Game Insights: The Kansas City Royals lead the series 1-0 against the Pittsburgh Pirates.Pittsburgh Pirates have a 70-77 overall record and a 37-39 home record.Kansas City Royals have an 81-67 overall record and a 36-37 road record.The game is the second meeting between the two teams this season.Bryan Reynolds leads the Pirates with a.281 batting average, while Bobby Witt Jr. leads the Royals with a.332 batting average.Pittsburgh Pirates have a 4.15 ERA in their last 10 games, while the Royals have a 2.90 ERA.Injuries include Henry Davis (hand) and Michael Lorenzen (hamstring) for the Pirates, and Vinnie Pasquantino (thumb) and Will Smith (back) for the Royals.Pittsburgh Pirates' Mitch Keller (11-9, 3.85 ERA) and Kansas City Royals' Michael Wacha (12-7, 3.34 ERA) are the starting pitchers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is part of a three-game series between the Royals and Pirates.The Royals have the sixth-ranked ERA in the AL at 3.87.The Pirates have struggled when allowing home runs, going 33-60 in such games.The Royals have outscored opponents by seven runs in their last 10 games.The Pirates have a 6-4 record with a.229 batting average in their last 10 games.
